summary:
Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Paul Merson reignited his dispute with Andros Townsend after Townsend played only 7 minutes in Tottenham's 0-0 draw with Burnley, posting a mocking tweet about it. The conflict originally began when Merson criticized Townsend's England selection in his Sky Sports column, saying "if Andros Townsend can get in (the England team) then it opens it up to anybody." Townsend then scored England's equalizer against Italy, proving Merson wrong, who subsequently admitted his mistake and praised the goal. Townsend responded on Twitter, referencing Merson's earlier criticism. Despite the apparent resolution of their disagreement, Merson couldn't resist taking another jab at Townsend following his brief substitute appearance for Tottenham.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Chelsea have made a formal offer for FC Tokyo's 22-year-old forward Yoshinori Muto, according to club president Naoki Ogane. The Japan international, who has 11 caps and scored once for his country, has been with FC Tokyo since 2013 and recently graduated from Keio University with an economics degree. If the move is completed, Muto would join Chelsea's partner club Vitesse Arnhem on loan next season and would become the first Japanese player to represent Chelsea. A £4million deal has been suggested, though Muto has not yet decided whether to accept the offer. The club president states that Chelsea's interest is not connected to their £200million sponsorship deal with Japanese company Yokohama Rubber. Muto has performed well for FC Tokyo, scoring 16 goals in 37 appearances overall and three goals in four games this season.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

A large-scale Finnish study of over 12,000 children found that babies given antibiotics in their first six months of life are more likely to be overweight as toddlers. The research, published in Pediatrics, showed that by age two, one in five boys and one in ten girls were overweight or obese, with those who received early antibiotics being particularly likely to be overweight. Boys appeared more susceptible to antibiotic-related weight gain and were also slightly taller.

The researchers suggest antibiotics may contribute to weight gain by killing beneficial gut bacteria that normally consume food, leaving more available for the body, and potentially increasing appetite. While the study doesn't prove causation, the authors warn that antibiotic use in infancy may contribute to the worldwide childhood obesity epidemic. The findings add to existing concerns about antibiotic over-prescription, which has previously been linked to increased risks of eczema, digestive problems, and antibiotic resistance.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

A Queen's Guard at Buckingham Palace slipped and fell on a manhole cover during the Changing of the Guard ceremony in front of hundreds of tourists. The guard lost his footing, slid sideways, knocked his bearskin hat on his sentry box, and dropped his rifle before quickly scrambling back to his feet. The embarrassing incident was caught on camera by tourist David Meadwell from Newcastle-upon-Tyne on a Thursday afternoon. The guard appeared embarrassed as he realized how many people witnessed his fall. The slip is believed to have been caused by the metal protectors on his boot soles. The Ministry of Defence declined to comment on the incident.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

A&E networks are remaking the classic 1977 miniseries "Roots" to air in 2016. The original miniseries about African-American slave Kunta Kinte and his descendants had over 100 million viewers. Three networks (A&E, Lifetime, and History) will simulcast the remake, which will be described as "original" and "contemporary" while drawing more from Alex Haley's novel "Roots: The Saga of an American Family." 

LeVar Burton, who played Kunta Kinte in the original, will co-executive produce the new version. The remake will consult African and African-American history scholars for authenticity. Executive producer Mark Wolper is the son of the original's producer. The new version aims to reach both fans of the original and a new generation unfamiliar with the story, airing at a time when audiences have experienced both Barack Obama's presidency and recent racial unrest in U.S. cities.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Police are investigating allegations by former royal footman Christopher Lawler that palace staff at Clarence House attempted to force him into an orgy in January 1978. Lawler, then 27, claims he was groped and physically restrained by multiple male staff members on his first day of work at the Queen Mother's London residence. He says he escaped, was subsequently threatened to stay quiet, and left the job immediately after his complaint drew an angry response from Clarence House. 

Lawler, now 64, contacted palace officials again last year following inquiries into historical VIP abuse cases from the 1970s-80s. He claims his complaints were initially ignored for months before being passed to Scotland Yard. A retired royal aide in his 80s was interviewed but denied involvement, stating he was working at Balmoral at the time. The Royal Household has stated it will cooperate fully with the ongoing police investigation.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Jesse and Melissa Meek, an Oregon couple, announced their pregnancy through a rap video set to "The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air" theme song. The video, filmed in their car over five takes, has received over 1.7 million views on YouTube. In their parody version, they rap about living in Happy Valley, Oregon, and reveal their pregnancy journey - including that it took only two months to conceive (shorter than expected) and Melissa's realization she was pregnant after taking a test. The video concludes with them showing a sonogram of their unborn child. They created the video to share the news with distant family and friends, and were surprised by its viral success. The couple may make another video after learning the baby's gender.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

A dress worn by Vivien Leigh as Scarlett O'Hara in the 1939 film "Gone With the Wind" sold for $137,000 at a Heritage Auctions event in Beverly Hills. The gray jacket and skirt ensemble with black zigzag applique was worn in several key movie scenes and was part of a collection of over 150 items from the Academy Award-winning film. 

The dress originally belonged to James Tumblin, former head of Universal Studios' hair and makeup department, who purchased it for $20 in the 1960s when it was about to be discarded. The outfit has faded from its original slate blue-gray color to light gray over time. Other notable auction items included a straw hat worn by Leigh ($52,500), Clark Gable's suit as Rhett Butler ($55,000), and a bonnet worn by both Leigh and Olivia De Havilland ($30,000). The film, based on Margaret Mitchell's 1936 novel, celebrated its 75th anniversary and featured Hattie McDaniel, who became the first African-American to win an Academy Award.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

A two-year-old boy fell 10-12 feet into a cheetah exhibit at Cleveland Metroparks Zoo on Saturday around 3pm after his mother, who was holding him and another child, dangled him over the railing and he slipped. The child's parents rescued him from the pit before emergency responders arrived. The boy suffered minor bumps, bruises, and a leg injury but was not attacked by the cheetahs, who did not approach him. He was taken to MetroHealth Medical Center and listed in stable condition. Zoo officials received eyewitness accounts confirming the child was dangled over the railing, and the zoo plans to press child endangerment charges against the family. The exhibit was closed following the incident.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

A non-functioning speed camera in Handsworth, Birmingham has been angled to point directly at a residential house's front door. The yellow speed camera previously enforced the 30mph limit but has been inactive for over two years, along with approximately 300 other speed and traffic cameras that were switched off across the West Midlands in March 2013 due to obsolete technology. These have been replaced by mobile units, motorway cameras, and patrol officers. It's unclear who redirected the camera toward the house, but Birmingham City Council is aware of the situation and plans to send an engineer to assess the site, with possible complete removal of the camera. The council confirmed this camera will not be included in their planned digital technology pilot program.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Usain Bolt, a six-time Olympic gold medallist, will compete for Jamaica at the IAAF/BTC World Relays in the Bahamas on May 2 and 3. The Jamaica Athletics Administrative Association announced his participation in the relay championship. Bolt stated he is "fit, healthy and ready to run" and expressed enthusiasm about joining the team, noting Jamaica's successful relay tradition. JAAA General Secretary Garth Gayle expressed pleasure that "the world's fastest man" will be representing Jamaica at the event. The full Jamaican team roster will be announced later.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Barcelona teammates Neymar and Dani Alves attended a basketball El Clasico match on Thursday night, accompanied by Neymar's sister Rafaella, demonstrating their support for Barcelona's basketball team. Barcelona won the Euro League contest 85-80, though Real Madrid remains top of their division on points difference. Prior to this, Neymar played for Brazil in a 1-0 victory over Chile at the Emirates Stadium on Sunday, enduring several tough challenges during the match. Barcelona's football team had also recently won their own El Clasico to move four points clear at the top of La Liga, and they are set to face Celta Vigo on Sunday as they pursue a treble of trophies.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Italy is experiencing a surge in desperate migrants from Africa and the Middle East attempting to reach Europe. From Friday to Monday, 8,480 migrants were rescued by the Italian coast guard, which received SOS calls from 20 boats in distress on Monday alone. Save the Children fears 400 migrants may be missing from a capsized ship that reportedly carried 550 people and sank about 80 miles off the Libyan coast, though the Italian coast guard cannot confirm this incident as search operations found no survivors, bodies, or evidence of the capsizing.

Italy registered over 10,000 migrant arrivals in the first three months of 2015, with most coming from West Africa, Somalia, and Syria, using Libya as a transit country. At least 480 migrants have died crossing the Mediterranean since the beginning of the year due to bad weather, overcrowded vessels used by smugglers, and crews sometimes abandoning ships and leaving passengers to fend for themselves.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger does not know the exact reason Alexis Sanchez chose Arsenal over Liverpool, but is pleased with the decision. Sanchez, who cost £32million and has scored 19 goals this season, was courted by multiple elite clubs after Barcelona decided to let him leave following the World Cup. Wenger was aware of Liverpool's interest and believes it may have been connected to Barcelona's pursuit of Luis Suarez, potentially as part of an exchange deal. Wenger praises Sanchez's quick adaptation to English football, highlighting his efficiency, work-rate, and fighting spirit. Ahead of Arsenal's match against Liverpool, Wenger downplayed speculation about potentially signing Liverpool's Raheem Sterling, who has rejected a new contract offer. Wenger also praised Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers for successfully adapting his team after losing Suarez and dealing with Daniel Sturridge's injury.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Sir Bradley Wiggins, a four-time Olympic champion and 2012 Tour de France winner, will attempt to break cycling's hour record on June 7 at London's Olympic Velodrome. The 35-year-old aims to ride the furthest distance in 60 minutes, targeting the current record of 52.491km set by Australian Rohan Dennis in February. 

Wiggins recently finished his Team Sky career at Paris-Roubaix and will participate in the Tour de Yorkshire before preparing for this hour record attempt as part of his return to track cycling. He is also targeting an eighth Olympic medal at the 2016 Rio Olympics in the team pursuit event.

The UCI reformed regulations have reignited interest in the hour record, with several recent attempts including Jens Voigt (51.115km) and Matthias Brandle (51.852km). British rider Alex Dowsett will also attempt the record on May 2 in Manchester before Wiggins' attempt.

The event will be held at the Lee Valley VeloPark with hopes for a capacity 6,000 crowd, broadcast live on Sky Sports, with tickets going on sale April 19 priced at £29, £39, and £49.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Serena Williams defeated Sara Errani 4-6 7-6(3) 6-3 in Fed Cup singles play on Sunday, but called the struggle an "eye-opener" that revealed she wasn't ready for the claycourt season. Despite Williams' singles victory, the US lost 3-2 overall after Williams and Alison Riske were defeated 6-0 6-3 in doubles by Errani and Flavia Pennetta, resulting in the US being relegated to World Group II. Williams, the world No. 1 who recently won her 19th Grand Slam at the Australian Open, acknowledged she was playing like she was still on hard court rather than clay. The defeat marked Williams' first Fed Cup doubles loss and means the US team must work to return to the elite World Group next year.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

River Plate want to re-sign striker Radamel Falcao, with vice president Matias Patanian stating they "dream of Falcao Garcia" and "the doors are open." Falcao previously played for River Plate for eight years (joining at age 15 in 2001, making his first-team debut four years later) before leaving for Porto in 2009, scoring 34 goals in 90 appearances during his four first-team seasons. The 29-year-old Colombia forward is currently struggling on a season-long loan at Manchester United, having scored only four Premier League goals, though he recently scored three goals in two games for Colombia to equal their all-time scoring record with 24 goals. It's uncertain whether Manchester United will exercise their option to keep him or if he'll return to parent club Monaco, but River Plate admits any deal would be complicated.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

X Factor finalist and pop star Ella Henderson, age 19, has been announced as the official face of dry shampoo brand Batiste's 2015 'Ready For It' campaign. This marks Henderson's first brand collaboration since rising to fame on The X Factor in 2012. The campaign features images of Henderson against a blurred city background showcasing various hairstyles, including wavy hair worn down and a tousled half-ponytail style. The partnership was facilitated by the MILES agency and launched with a TV advertising campaign featuring Henderson's single "Mirror Man." Henderson expressed excitement about working with a brand she regularly uses, while her management noted that this is her first endorsement deal and praised the natural synergies between the platinum award-winning artist and the UK's number 1 dry shampoo brand.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Aaron Siler, 26, was fatally shot by police officer Pablo Torres on March 14 in Kenosha, Wisconsin, after Siler "armed himself with a weapon" during a confrontation following a vehicle and foot pursuit. Siler was wanted on an active felony probation and parole warrant. 

The Kenosha Professional Police Association erected a billboard featuring Torres and his dog with the message "Thank you for your support, Kenosha." This has caused shock and upset among Siler's family and friends, who call it "disrespectful" and want it removed. The police association states the billboard was intended to thank the community for support during recent incidents.

Torres is currently on leave pending investigation into the shooting. This was Torres' second shooting incident within 10 days - he had previously shot 66-year-old Terry Knight, who was armed with knives, in a separate incident that was later ruled justified. The investigation into Siler's death is ongoing.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Eight Iranian border guards were killed in clashes with militants near the Pakistan border on Monday in the southeastern town of Negur. Three militants were also killed by Iranian forces. According to Iranian officials, the militants crossed from Pakistan into Iran. The militant group Jaish al Adal claimed responsibility for the attack. This Sunni Muslim anti-Iranian group has emerged in Pakistan's Balochistan province in recent years and targets Shiites while opposing Iranian influence in Pakistan. The group has previously attacked Iranian territory, including a deadly 2013 attack that killed 14 Iranian border guards. Iran has criticized Pakistan for failing to control these militants, who reportedly flee back to Balochistan after attacks. Pakistan condemned the attack as terrorism and stated their security agencies are investigating, requesting evidence from Iran and promising to apprehend any militants who entered Pakistani territory.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Japan's Defense Minister Gen Nakatani told parliament that the country's Air Self Defense Force has never encountered extraterrestrial UFOs. This statement came in response to a question from lawmaker Antonio Inoki, a former professional wrestler who asked whether aircraft were scrambled to meet alien threats and if research was conducted on alien visitors. Nakatani explained that while fighter jets are scrambled to investigate unidentified objects that might violate airspace, they typically find birds or other earthly objects rather than extraterrestrial craft. Inoki, who claims to have seen a UFO himself, is known for his wrestling career, TV appearances, and unconventional political activities. The passage notes this isn't the first time Japanese politicians have discussed potential alien encounters, referencing a 2007 discussion about the legal implications of defending against an extraterrestrial invasion under Japan's pacifist constitution.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

A 35-year-old passenger named Jin Pai was hospitalized with deep cuts to his leg and buttocks after a toilet collapsed at Hefei Xinqiao International Airport in China. He had been standing on the toilet rim because he was worried about cleanliness and didn't want his bottom to touch the seat. The porcelain toilet tipped over and shattered, cutting him in several places. Too embarrassed to shout for help, he called his traveling companions instead before being taken to a Hefei hospital where he received dozens of stitches. While he initially confessed to friends that he was squatting on the toilet, he later told police he was sitting when the toilet gave way, possibly to avoid paying compensation. Authorities ruled it an accident and reminded people that toilets are designed for sitting, not standing.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Kevin Rebbie, 56, of Limerick Township, Pennsylvania, was arrested on multiple charges including aggravated indecent assault and sexual abuse of children. The case began when a 15-year-old girl discovered a hidden camera in her bathroom in March. The girl told investigators that Rebbie had been watching her for years and sexually abusing her from ages 9 to 13 while she slept. Police found 41 videos from the hidden camera showing the girl and other victims using the bathroom, with 34 videos capturing victims showering. The footage was recorded over a three to four-year period, and Rebbie admitted to filming multiple victims, including other juveniles, specifically purchasing the camera to record the now-15-year-old victim. Rebbie is being held on $500,000 bail with a preliminary hearing scheduled for May 1.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary:

Japanese photographer Yûki Aoyama, age 37, has created an unusual series of father-daughter portraits for his latest book, which roughly translates to "Daughter and Salary Man." The images feature teenage daughters looking directly at the camera while their fathers leap into the air in dramatic poses. The daughters wear casual clothing while the fathers are dressed in sharp suits. According to the photographer's website, these images allow fathers who usually must act serious to express their fun side by being "a hero jumping the sky." The photographs are taken at various Japanese landmarks, and while little is known about why the series was created, it has generated significant online interest due to its curious and unconventional approach to family portraits.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Paul Downton was dismissed as England's managing director, which has created an opportunity for Kevin Pietersen's potential return to the England cricket team. Pietersen participated in Surrey's team photo session at the KIA Oval ahead of the County Championship season, appearing both contemplative and jovial during the event. He was controversially dropped from the England team by Downton in 2014, with his last international appearance being during England's whitewash Ashes defeat in Australia. Pietersen has now rejoined Surrey in an attempt to force his way back into England's Test team, with Surrey set to begin their campaign against Glamorgan on April 19 and play Oxford MCCU on Sunday. England hopes to regain the Ashes on home soil this summer.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Romanian football club Ceahlaul Piatra Neamt, who are facing relegation, have dismissed Brazilian coach Ze Maria for the second time within a week. Ze Maria, a former Brazil international defender who played for Inter Milan and Parma, was initially fired on Wednesday due to poor performance, then reinstated the following day when owner Angelo Massone gave him another opportunity. However, after a 2-0 defeat to FC Botosani on Saturday, which left the team 16th in the standings and six points from safety, Ze Maria was sacked again. He had been the club's third coach this season since replacing Florin Marin in January, and will now be succeeded by Serbian coach Vanya Radinovic.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Radamel Falcao moved from Monaco to Manchester United on a season-long loan but has struggled significantly, scoring only four goals all season and failing to reach his pre-injury performance levels. Manchester United is unlikely to pay the £46million required to make his transfer permanent. According to his former Monaco teammate Nabil Dirar, while Falcao was unhappy during his time in France at Monaco, Dirar believes Falcao now regrets leaving Monaco for Manchester United, as he would have had more playing time and Champions League participation if he had stayed.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

A very tall man wearing a distinctive cartoon mask and fluoro orange sweatshirt robbed a dairy on Union Street in east Christchurch on Saturday around 12:30pm. The masked robber demanded cash from the dairy owner's 30-year-old daughter, threw the cash register to the ground, and escaped with the till drawer and approximately $1,500 in cash. The incident was captured on security footage. No weapons were used, but the robber remains at large. New Zealand police are appealing to the public for help identifying the suspect and have asked anyone with information to contact Crimestoppers or message police online.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Kaitlyn Granado, a 24-year-old math teacher at MacArthur High School in Irving, Texas, has been arrested twice for inappropriate sexual relationships with underage students. She was first arrested on March 19 for admitting to kissing a 15-year-old student and allowing him to touch her breasts in April of the previous year. She was then arrested again on Monday after a second 15-year-old student accused her of having sex with him in her car on two consecutive nights (January 18 and 19) near a Dallas school. The second case came to light through school rumors investigated by police. Granado has been suspended from teaching, placed on administrative leave, and released on $50,000 bail for the second arrest. The school district has confirmed they took immediate action to prevent her from working with students or being on school property.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

A video showing a large crocodile swimming through a marina in Puerto Vallarta, Mexico, with a dead pet dog in its jaws has been viewed over 500,000 times online. The dog, wearing a red collar, belonged to a local bike shop owner and was killed when it approached the water's edge out of curiosity. New Zealander Tim Weston, who was vacationing there with his wife, witnessed the incident and reported that the crocodile held onto the dog for hours. The crocodile came from a nearby sanctuary located 200 meters up the river. Crocodiles are common in Puerto Vallarta due to the area being built among mangroves where these creatures have lived for centuries. American Crocodiles in Mexico can reach 6 meters in length and are living closer to humans due to urbanization. The video has generated horrified reactions on social media after being posted on the Bogged Facebook page.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Hull City lost 2-0 to Southampton, leaving them just two points above the relegation zone with six games remaining. Manager Steve Bruce remains confident Hull can avoid relegation despite achieving only six wins this season (below his original target of 10). Hull face difficult upcoming fixtures against Liverpool, Arsenal, Tottenham and Manchester United. Bruce attributes their struggles to long-term injuries to key players including Mohamed Diame, James Chester, Michael Dawson, Nikica Jelavic, and Robert Snodgrass. Southampton's goals came from a James Ward-Prowse penalty and Graziano Pelle, moving them to fifth place. Southampton manager Ronald Koeman had to address a disciplinary issue when Sadio Mane attempted to take the penalty instead of designated taker Ward-Prowse.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Teacher Ian Guffick was banned from the classroom for at least two years after allowing pupils at Mitton Manor Primary School in Tewkesbury to change their SATs exam answers after the exam session had finished. The 31-year-old also altered pupils' answers himself before submitting the papers. Following a tip-off and investigation by the local education authority, the Department for Education annulled all SATs results for the entire school in 2014. Guffick admitted to unacceptable professional conduct and left his job, though he claimed he only asked pupils to make answers more legible. A conduct panel found his behavior dishonest but not fraudulent, noting he showed remorse. The prohibition order was issued by Paul Heathcote on behalf of Education Secretary Nicky Morgan, with Guffick given 28 days to appeal to the High Court.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Anders Lindegaard, a Manchester United goalkeeper, married Swedish model Misse Beqiri in a beach wedding in Mauritius last year. The couple, who have been dating since 2012 and have a son together, were recently enjoying time off together in the English sunshine. Despite Lindegaard's lack of playing time at Manchester United - making only 19 league appearances in five seasons since joining in 2010 and now being third-choice goalkeeper behind David de Gea and Victor Valdes - he appears content in his personal life. Beqiri is an active Instagram user with over 17,000 followers who regularly posts modeling photos. While Lindegaard has been told he can leave United and was linked with a January move that didn't materialize, his marriage and family life remain successful despite his struggles on the pitch.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

The 13 glowing blue letters that once hung above Yankee Stadium failed to sell at a Sotheby's auction on Wednesday. The 10-feet-tall letters were expected to bring $300,000-$600,000 but received no legitimate bids, with only a Sotheby's employee bidding $260,000 to start the auction. The letters are currently owned by Yankees Hall of Famer Reggie Jackson, who purchased them after the stadium's final game in 2008. Jackson, now 68, bought the letters "on a lark" and wanted "a new generation to own and enjoy this icon." The letters had been displayed at the stadium since 1976. Additionally, a New York Mets bullpen car from the late 1960s was also auctioned, selling for $112,500 despite being estimated at only $20,000-$30,000.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers addressed incidents involving players Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe, who were pictured with nitrous oxide and shisha pipes during a challenging week. Rodgers spoke to both players about their professional responsibilities but will not discipline them, choosing to move past the matter. Sterling will lead Liverpool's attack at Wembley on Sunday against Aston Villa in the FA Cup semi-final, replacing injured Daniel Sturridge. Captain Steven Gerrard is available after completing a three-match suspension, though Rodgers hasn't confirmed if he'll start. Rodgers emphasized that previous near-misses in competitions are part of the journey toward success, referencing Liverpool's close title race last season and Capital One Cup semi-final exit, as he aims to guide the team to their first FA Cup final under his management.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Arsenal playmaker Mesut Ozil returned to London after international duty and posted a picture relaxing at home with his dog. The German midfielder performed well as Germany beat Georgia 2-0 in their Euro 2016 qualifier on Sunday and is now preparing for Arsenal's upcoming Premier League match against Liverpool. Ozil, who was signed from Real Madrid for £42.5million in 2013, missed Arsenal's previous game against Newcastle due to illness, though there were unsubstantiated claims he was spotted in a Berlin nightclub. Since returning from injury in January, he has been in excellent form with four assists and three goals. Ozil stated he is finally adjusting well to English football, saying he fits in "perfectly" and enjoys the demanding schedule with frequent matches and no winter break.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Barcelona president Josep Maria Bartomeu has dismissed speculation about replacing manager Luis Enrique, stating the club is "very happy" with his performance. Enrique, who took charge last summer on a two-year contract running until 2016, has led Barcelona to within six games of winning La Liga. Bartomeu praised Enrique's work ethic and noted that Barcelona remains in contention for three trophies as the season enters its final stretch. The manager's recent success includes a comfortable victory over Valencia, with goals from Luis Suarez and Lionel Messi, demonstrating the team's strong form under his leadership.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Jordan Henderson has agreed to a new long-term contract with Liverpool worth around £100,000 per week, running until 2020. The 24-year-old midfielder, who had 14 months left on his previous deal, is the third key player to sign an extension under Brendan Rodgers, following Daniel Sturridge and Philippe Coutinho. Henderson has performed excellently this season with 13 assists and seven goals from midfield, and is being considered as a potential replacement for Steven Gerrard as club captain when Gerrard moves to LA Galaxy. The new contract provides Liverpool with positive news following their FA Cup semi-final defeat. Meanwhile, talks with Raheem Sterling regarding his contract extension have been postponed until the end of the season.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Filipe Luis, Chelsea's left back, has stated he wants to remain at Chelsea until his three-year contract ends, despite Atletico Madrid considering bringing him back. Since joining from Atletico Madrid last July, Luis has struggled to secure the left back position at Chelsea. Atletico hopes this difficulty may work in their favor for a potential return. Luis recently played for Brazil in friendly matches against France and Chile. With Chelsea leading the Premier League, manager Jose Mourinho is keeping the team focused on winning their remaining nine games to secure the title, emphasizing the need for concentration and maximum effort in each match.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Nathan Hughes had his three-match ban overturned on appeal after initially being suspended for accidentally knocking out George North with his knee while scoring a try on March 27. Hughes received a red card and was originally deemed "reckless" by the disciplinary panel, despite no intent being found. The ban faced fierce criticism from players and observers who defended Hughes, calling it a "joke." North was left unconscious - his third head injury in two months - and was advised to take at least a month off. Hughes missed Wasps' Champions Cup quarter-final loss to Toulon while awaiting his appeal. The appeal panel concluded that "no act of foul play took place" as the incident was accidental, officially rescinding the red card and ban. Hughes is now free to return to action immediately.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Fiery red sunsets appeared over Washington and Seattle over the weekend, caused by smoke from wildfires in southeastern Siberia. The fires began when farmers burned grass in their fields on April 14, but strong winds caused the flames to spread out of control throughout the region, destroying dozens of villages before rescue crews extinguished them. Atmospheric winds carried the lingering smoke across the Pacific Ocean to the Pacific Northwest, affecting parts of Oregon, Washington, and British Columbia. The intense red color occurs because smoke particles filter out shorter wavelength colors (greens, blues, yellows, purples) from sunlight, allowing red and orange colors to penetrate unfiltered. The effect is most dramatic during sunrises and sunsets when light travels through more atmosphere. As the smoke dissipates, air quality will improve and the red sunsets will fade.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Becky Schoenig of St. Louis had her brand new 2015 Ford Fusion stolen from her driveway on Monday night, just over a month after purchasing it. On April 1, police returned the car after receiving a tip from Mick Sexton, who recognized the vehicle. The car thieves had modified it with red spray-painted rims, red side detailing, and orange steering wheel accents. Rather than being upset, Schoenig responded positively on Facebook, thanking the thieves for "pimping out" her vehicle. However, she is having the car professionally cleaned due to strong cigarette and marijuana odors. To honor Sexton for finding her car, she is creating a special smoothie called "The Sexton on Wheels" at her restaurant, The Hot Pot.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Manchester City players face losing £500,000 each in bonuses if they fail to qualify for the Champions League this season. The club uses these incentivized contracts to comply with financial fair play requirements, with approximately £12 million total at stake for the squad. City currently sits in fourth place but could be just four points ahead of Liverpool if Liverpool wins their next match. The team needs to finish in the top four to qualify for Champions League, with the top three teams qualifying automatically and fourth place requiring a qualifying round win. The results show improved organization without flooding the system with more referrals, and importantly, better survival rates with Denmark catching up to other Scandinavian countries at a faster pace. The passage contends that England's current policy under Stuart Lancaster of excluding players based abroad is "old-fashioned" and "ridiculous," comparing it unfavorably to football where overseas players are still selected.

Key examples cited include:
- Matt Giteau and Drew Mitchell performing well for Toulon and being available for Australia
- Steffon Armitage's improved performance since moving to France from London Irish
- Nick Abendanon becoming a better player after moving to France
- Jonny Wilkinson's continued excellence while playing in France

The author argues that England should select their best players regardless of location because:
- Players often improve when playing overseas
- The World Cup should feature the world's best players
- As hosts, England will be judged on World Cup performance
- Players and fans deserve the strongest possible team
- Other countries like South Africa continue selecting overseas-based players like Bryan Habana

The passage concludes that England's policy leaves them potentially weakened and that club loyalty shouldn't restrict international team selection.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Open Garden developed the FireChat app, which enables messaging without internet or mobile signal by using wireless mesh networks. The app has been downloaded over 5 million times and works by creating localized networks where phones become nodes that pass data between each other, with a range limit of around 200 feet.

To strengthen these off-grid networks, Open Garden created Greenstone - a small, egg-shaped device that acts as a beacon or booster for wireless mesh networks. Greenstone can store up to 1,000 recent messages, has a one-year battery life, and currently works with FireChat at a 20-foot range. Messages are stored on the device until another FireChat user comes within range.

The technology uses Apple's Multipeer Connectivity Framework (similar features exist on Android via Bluetooth) and offers secure, anonymous messaging. It's particularly useful in situations like planes, underground transport, crowded events, or areas with poor connectivity. Open Garden is currently working with manufacturers to bring Greenstone to market.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Burlesque performer Lillian Bustle from New Jersey gave a TED talk advocating for reclaiming the word "fat" as a neutral, body-positive descriptor rather than an insult. She argues that "fat" should be treated like other descriptive words such as "short" or "wife" - simply honest descriptions without negative connotations.

Key points from her talk include:
- Size discrimination in workplaces has increased 66% over 30 years
- Girls aged 11-17 most commonly wish to be thinner
- Studies show increased exposure to body diversity leads to greater acceptance of different body types

Lillian, who weighs 240lbs, began performing burlesque in 2012 as a way to expose audiences to fuller figures in a positive context. She describes the experience as empowering and body-positive, helping her overcome initial insecurities about her appearance.

Her TED talk, originally given in 2014 but posted on YouTube three weeks prior to this article, has garnered nearly 38,000 views with mostly positive feedback. She received thank-you messages and personal stories, including from a teenage girl who said the video helped her and her sister reevaluate their body image. Despite some negative comments, Lillian believes the body-positivity movement is succeeding.

Walcott has been named as a substitute in 17 of Arsenal's 33 Premier League games this season. The Arsenal players will wear similar Lanvin attire for their FA Cup final against Aston Villa at Wembley on May 30, and Walcott hopes to earn a start in Arsenal's upcoming match against Hull.

Legendary make-up effects artist Rick Baker is auctioning off his collection of 417 original props and puppets from his 30-year career through his Cinovation Studio. The auction will take place on May 29 at the Hilton Universal City in Los Angeles and online at propstore.com. 

The collection is valued at approximately $746,100 and includes items from over 50 film productions, including blockbusters like Men in Black, Batman Forever, How the Grinch Stole Christmas, Gremlins, Harry and the Hendersons, and Michael Jackson's Thriller music video and Moonwalker film. Individual items range in estimated value from $1,500 to $40,000, with some expected to sell for even higher amounts. Notable pieces include the Alien Edgar Bug from Men in Black ($40,000), the Mikey costume from Men in Black ($30,000), and the Grinch costume ($8,000). This represents the first time these items from Baker's studio are being offered to the public.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Seven-year-old Carwyn Scott-Howell from Wales died in a skiing accident in the French Alps resort of Flaine. While on the family's last ski run of the day, Carwyn became separated from his mother Ceri and nine-year-old sister Antonia when the sister lost her ski. Carwyn continued ahead and left the piste, entering dense woodland where he removed his skis and continued on foot, apparently trying to reach the resort he could see through the trees. He fell over a 164-foot drop and died. Police found his body by following footprints in the snow that showed sliding marks where he had navigated steep terrain. 

Carwyn was described by his family as a "daring, outgoing and determined" child who was a competent skier since age three and modeled himself after TV adventurer Bear Grylls. His family said his death left a "vast void in their hearts." The boy attended Ysol y Bannau school in Brecon, and his family runs an award-winning farm shop. His body was ready for repatriation while the family remained in the Alps.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Laura Scurr, a 15-year-old from Whitley Bay, developed anorexia at age 13 after being bullied about her weight and feeling pressure to achieve a "size zero" figure. What began as a sensible diet with her mother's agreement escalated into a dangerous obsession where she would hide food, lie about eating, and survive on just one piece of fruit or about 100 calories per day. Her severe food restriction caused her body to shut down - her heart rate slowed dramatically, leading to dizziness and fainting. After a week of eating virtually nothing, Laura collapsed at home and was rushed to intensive care, where she spent a week on a heart monitor. Following her hospitalization, she received support from eating disorder organizations and mental health services for her recovery. Laura has since recovered and made it to the semi-finals of Miss Teen GB, a competition that promotes positive body image away from size zero stereotypes. Her story highlights the dangerous pressures young girls face regarding body image and weight.

Liverpool unveiled their new 2015/16 home kit at Anfield on Friday, featuring players including Raheem Sterling, Daniel Sturridge, Martin Skrtel, and Simon Mignolet. The new gingham design is the first from New Balance, who signed a record-breaking £300million four-year deal to replace Warrior as Liverpool's kit suppliers. 

During the event, Liverpool supporters made it clear they expect Sterling to remain at the club, with one fan shouting "make sure we see you in that next season." This comes after Sterling recently rejected a £100,000-a-week contract and expressed interest in Arsenal links. However, Liverpool are adamant the 20-year-old will not leave this summer.

The players also discussed their upcoming FA Cup semi-final against Aston Villa at Wembley, with both Sterling and Sturridge expressing excitement about the match and praising the fans' support. The new kit features white branding, an all-new collar style, and includes the memorial flame and number 96 in tribute to the Hillsborough disaster victims.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

**Main Achievement**: University of Manchester researchers have created the largest single high-definition map of dark matter, covering 0.4% of the night sky.

**Project Details**: This is part of the five-year Dark Energy Survey (DES) led by Fermilab, which aims to eventually map 12.5% of the sky to create a 3D view of dark matter. The survey uses the Dark Energy Camera on the Victor M. Blanco telescope in Chile.

**Methodology**: Since dark matter cannot be directly observed, researchers measure its gravitational effects on galaxies through a technique called gravitational lensing. The team analyzed 130 million telescope images, measuring galaxy shapes with extreme precision to detect distortions caused by dark matter's gravity.

**Scientific Significance**: The map shows that galaxies form near dark matter concentrations, supporting current cosmological theories. Dark matter makes up at least 80% of matter in the universe, and studying its distribution helps scientists understand both dark matter and dark energy.

**Current Status**: The survey has completed two years and will finish by 2018, ultimately mapping one-eighth of the night sky. The released map represents only 3% of the total area that will be documented.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary:

Pablo Mandado (27, Spanish) and Ilze Zebolde (31, Latvian) are a couple who quit their restaurant jobs in Manchester to pursue their dream of discovering the world by bicycle. They met in Riga in 2011 and have been cycling for 356 days, covering almost 7,000 miles through 16 countries on an open-ended journey with no set plans or agenda.

They maintain extremely low costs, spending less than 3 euros per person per day (10 euro cents per kilometer). They keep expenses down through free accommodation - primarily camping (161 nights), using hosting websites like Couchsurfing (66 nights) and Warmshowers (44 nights), with food being their main expense at 2.74 euros per day each. Their diet consists mainly of basic foods like pasta, bread, rice, and seasonal produce.

Their route started in London, went through Western Europe (France, Spain, Portugal), then Eastern Europe (Italy, Slovenia, Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Montenegro, Albania, Macedonia, Greece), and into Asia (Turkey, Georgia, Armenia). They plan to continue across Asia and the Pacific, eventually cycling through the Americas, expecting to be on the road for several more years.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Tibetan mastiffs in China have experienced a dramatic fall from luxury status symbols to slaughterhouse victims. Just a year ago, these dogs (which can weigh up to 80 kg) commanded prices up to £1.2 million each. However, they are now so unpopular that they are being sent to slaughterhouses for hotpot meat and leather.

The decline is attributed to two main factors: China's anti-corruption crackdown has eliminated the practice of wealthy businessmen gifting these dogs to officials for influence, and several Chinese cities have banned ownership of dogs over 50 kg. Additionally, poor breeding practices driven by profit led to a glut of low-quality dogs.

The cruel reality was exposed when animal welfare workers rescued 20 mastiffs being transported to slaughter - a third were already dead, none had been fed for three days, and several had broken bones. Hundreds more dogs across China are feared to face similar fates through theft by gangs and disposal by unscrupulous breeders. The breed's boom began in 2005, with one puppy selling for £1.2 million just 13 months ago, but urbanization has also made people realize these dogs are unsuited for city living.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

A survey of 600 women in the Paris area found that every woman surveyed claimed to have experienced some form of sexual harassment on the city's public transport, with half first experiencing harassment before age 18. The harassment ranges from insults and intimidating behavior to sexual assault and rape. As a result, 60% of women fear being attacked on public transport compared to 30% of men. These attacks, often unreported and "invisible," force women to alter their daily routines, routes, transportation methods, schedules, and clothing to avoid confrontation, effectively excluding them from public spaces. The findings led to calls for campaigns to address sexist and threatening behavior on public transport, with officials emphasizing the need to educate women that such treatment is not normal and to inform both perpetrators and witnesses that these acts constitute punishable sexual assault.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary:

Leeds-based Direct Line conducted a survey of 2,000 people to identify the top 10 "everyday emergencies" that cause stress in daily life. The top issue was not being able to sleep (46%), followed by losing keys (37%) and being stuck in traffic when late (35%).

As part of their #everydayfix competition, Direct Line partnered with London design company Makerversity to create prototype solutions. Three products made the final shortlist:

1. **Snooze** - An alarm clock that connects to your phone and silences notifications to ensure better sleep
2. **Forget Me Lock** - A key attachment that shows green when a door is open and red when locked, so you can remember if you locked your door
3. **Nipper** - A small mobile phone charger that uses any household battery as an energy source

The public can vote for their favorite product on Twitter using the #everydayfix hashtag. The winning product will receive funding through a Kickstarter campaign and be developed into an actual product. Other prototype ideas that didn't make the shortlist included a cycling helmet with bone conduction headphones for navigation, a parking space alert device, and an app for message relay when phones die.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Police Crime Commissioner Vera Baird is facing a Ministry of Justice investigation after awarding £500,000 of taxpayers' money to Victims First Northumbria, a charity she runs as director alongside Chief Constable Sue Sim. Critics, including Labour MP Keith Vaz, have accused this of being a conflict of interest and "inappropriate," describing the situation as creating a "soap opera" within Northumbria Police. The investigation will determine whether conflict of interest rules were broken when Baird allocated public funds to commission victim services for a charity she directly oversees. Sue Sim, who previously faced bullying allegations investigated by Baird, has announced her retirement from the force in June. Baird defends her decision, stating all Ministry of Justice procedures were followed.

Based on the passage, here is a concise summary of the core information:

Five people were involved in a 42-hour assault on 53-year-old Greg Valecce in March 2014 in Philadelphia. The attack was led by 21-year-old Corry Campbell, who believed Valecce had injured his cat Pebbles and stolen money and marijuana. The group, dubbed the "tattoo terrorists," held Valecce in a basement where they beat him, tied him to a chair, and forcibly tattooed offensive images and symbols on his body including swastikas, racial slurs, and "RIP Pebbles." Valecce suffered broken ribs, wrists, and facial bones before escaping and contacting police. Three defendants have been sentenced: Campbell received 20 years in prison, Carl Halin received 20 years, and Sandra Ng received 23 months. Two others, David Thomas and Jennifer Pratt, are awaiting sentencing and trial respectively. All were charged with aggravated assault, conspiracy, and false imprisonment.

Manchester United have made an official approach to sign 21-year-old PSV Eindhoven winger Memphis Depay, with manager Louis van Gaal keen to make him one of his first summer signings. Van Gaal is familiar with Depay from Holland's 2014 World Cup campaign where they finished third. 

Depay is having an exceptional season, scoring 20 goals in 26 league games and helping PSV win their first Eredivisie title in seven years with a 4-1 victory over Heerenveen. PSV's technical director confirmed contact from Manchester United, Paris Saint-Germain, and a third major European club, noting that offers are now for significantly higher amounts than Tottenham's rejected £15 million bid last summer.

The Dutch international, who joined PSV at age 12, is described as a pacy left-winger with strong dribbling skills and powerful shooting ability. He has been compared favorably to young Cristiano Ronaldo by scouts and tipped to potentially match Arjen Robben's level by his current manager.

However, he believes marriage should be defined as between one man and one woman, and that same-sex marriage is not a constitutional right. Rubio announced his presidential run last week and reportedly has financial commitments exceeding the $47 million expected to be needed for the primary campaign.
